Choices:  A: write an essay B: organize thoughts C: speak information D: summarize main points E: have information<n><n>### Response:		<n>Ways that we can share what we know is through the medium of our choice. For example, we can write blogs, speeches, share photos, and videos. But we all know what the best way is<n><n>### Input:(Answer: E: have information)<n>Now that we are done exploring how we can share information, we can go ahead and go about sharing it.<n>So, let us begin by looking at our choices.<n><n>A: We have notices to send as a company and that should be done by printing them and handing them out for our employees to read.<n><n>We can go ahead and do that. This is the traditional way to pass information. But of course, it is not very efficient and is not very interactive with the information receiver<n><n>B: We are required to hand in some documents. Thus we can either type the document and save in another device, or manually type it ourselves and submit it.<n><n>Both are doable. Personally, I prefer handwritten files instead of typewritten because I feel it is more human-friendly than typewritten files because of its familiarity. Not to say that typewritten files are bad or anything.<n><n>C: We will need to send people information via the internet by sending emails about everything. Even if emails will be deleted later, or forwarded to other people. There are people that simply just ignore and delete emails out of their mailbox if they do not have time to read them<n><n>C: This is the most efficient way to pass information. This allows people to share information at the same time by simply sending the same email at the same time.<n><n>D: What we can do is summarise the information for people on the whole by sending a summary of the information to our coworkers to save them the trouble of reading the whole thing if they have no time to do so.<n><n>We, therefore, have a way of passing information in many forms to both people and computers. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What could happen to a paper if you leave it outside even if it does not move? Even if the paper doesn't move, there is a risk of the paper getting wet and becoming damaged, making it "ripped."<n><n>Answer:<n><n>### Additional Feedback: <n>- Please take extra care while providing feedback. <n>- Use clear and concise language to explain where the response is incorrect or incomplete. <n>- Avoid comments that include personal opinions or value judgments. <n>- If you would like to make further clarification, edit to add a comment using the "Edit" link. <n><n>### Preview Panel<n><n>Input: 14. Read each sentence.  Then, decide how it can be improved by adding a sentence of proper form.  Make improvements as indicated. When complete, write the number<n>### paragraph on the line under the sentence to which it was added.<n><n>"Such attitudes are rooted in social expectations and fear of what others might think about us.  They can also be a way to explain things in which we were involved, without getting caught in the resulting guilt or judgment.  If someone else committed evil, it's easy to justify our own behaviors by claiming that the other person drove us to make choices that we wouldn't have made otherwise.  It's also much easier to ignore unpleasant feelings of guilt or regret by claiming that the action wasn't a problem because someone else was involved in it, <n><n>### Example:<n><n>“An apple for every person on campus?  That’s ridiculous!  What would they do, just throw them away?”<n>### Improved<n><n>**This sort of reaction is not uncommon.  It's an attempt to ignore a painful truth rather than confronting it.  It doesn't help us find solutions, it gets rid of them.”**<n>

Choices:  A: reach tentative agreement B: suicide C: examine thing D: commit murder E: stay in bed<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. First, the first word of the sentence "they" is plural, and therefore the answer must also be a plural noun.<n>2. Secondly, the answer should provide a noun appropriate for the verb "get close" and the phrase "on a few things."<n><n>As the sentence is about getting close to something, the answer should be related to something that is far away, and not something that is nearby.<n><n>From the choices given, 'get close on a few things' can be found in both A:'reach tentative agreement', and B:'suicide'.<n><n>However, choice B does not fit as the actions suggested are all of an extreme nature of which 'get close' would be an inappropriate comparison.<n><n>It is thus concluded that the answer is A:'reach a tentative agreement'.<n>3. If the sentence were in fact referring to 'get close' as in getting close to an intimate relationship with someone, then A:'reach agreement' or C:'examine' would fit. As this does not seem to be the case, we can thus conclude that the answer is A.<n><n>Answer: A: reach tentative agrement<n><n>### Instructions: Complete the sentence by inserting a word (or words) that replaces the boldfaced italicized word or phrase.<n><n>### I:  Put him on a tight leash because he was so  to his master that they would make you uncomfortable.<n><n>### II:  I feel so  about my situation, I'm willing to take any job, just so long as it pays the bills.<n><n>### III:  He is in a state of  with all his neighbors.<n><n>### IV:  Don't worry about that, I'm not  and I'll do my best to find a solution for you.<n><n>### V:  I can't afford to buy a new car; let me tell you, my vehicle is  old.<n><n><n>### Instructon: Rewrite the sentence in which the boldfaced italics is replaced using the provided alternative word(s).<n><n>### I. "Put him on a tight leach because he was too affectionate that they would make you feel uncomfortable."   Answer: "Put him on a leash because
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Though she made the cut years ago, its figurative scars would never what? Choices:  A: joining B: put together C: stitch D: heal E: paste<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following open-ended response.<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>The question states that "though she made the cut years [x]ago, its figurative scares would never [x]." This implies that we should find a word that can be used to express the idea of never being able to heal or improve after an initial attempt, even after many years have passed.<n><n>Looking further down the sentence, it says that the "figurative scars" in question would be used to define the word we seek.<n><n>As an analogy, think of a scar as a permanent reminder of an injury, not only physically but also emotionally. A scar that is healed is no longer a physical reminder of the injury, but it may still be a reminder to some degree.<n><n>Consider the word "put"--it is usually used as a command to assemble something into something, but it isn't necessarily permanent. "Paste" is usually used in a sense of repairing a damaged surface by sticking pieces of paper or similar material over it. It also wouldn't indicate a significant emotional impact.<n><n>"Stitch" typically refers to sewing something together, which has a limited lifespan since it would eventually fall apart. "Stitch" also doesn't carry an intense significance.<n><n>"Join" is a verb that usually means to unite or connect things, but it doesn't necessarily imply the word, "together". "Join" is also commonly used in sentences referring to people forming a union or combination.<n><n>Lastly, the word "heal" implies the completion of an injury, usually through medical care, and the word "never" implies that the injury cannot be undone. Choice C, "join", is most appropriate.<n><n>Answer: C: join<n><n>### Write an instruction<n>>Write a task with an open-ended question that requires a response with more than one correct answer.<n>### Rationale:<n>The goal is to find a way to formulate a question that prompts students to formulate and write answers with multiple possibilities. Writing about hypothetical situations or what could be but isn't often provide more options for correctness than writing about what is or what is known about a topic. Therefore, asserting that the best answer is one with multiple correct answers is a good guideline for this

Choices:  A: owner B: foot C: subordinate D: base E: point<n><n>### Response:		Head of department yelling at subordinate<n><n>### Why:<n>First, we identify the context of the sentence:<n><n>>The branch head of one of the major food processing companies that are involved in the production process is having a heated argument with the head of the department. <n><n>This is a context where the main character is a high-authority figure, likely higher management who is involved in a conflict with a subordinate. <n><n>Next, we identify the grammatical features that indicate the main characters.<n><n>>Who was the head of one of the...<n><n>This statement describes a head in the possession of the main character, who it is, and where they are located. <n><n>Looking at our options,<n><n>>A: owner<n>While an owner can be the head of a company, it is not necessarily the manager that is the one having the conflict.<n><n>>B: foot<n>While there may be conflicts between a head and a subordinate, this does not fit the context well (they are in conflict, not in conflict with each other).<n><n>>C: subordinate<n>There is no evidence of a conflict with the main character, but rather a conflict between two managers.<n><n>>D: base<n>This is not applicable in any way, having nothing to do with the context.<n><n>>E: point<n>While there may have been a point, the context states that they are having a conflict, not talking about the point. <n><n><n>Hence, only the option that is applicable in this context is<n><n>>C: Subordinate

Choices:  A: tennis racket B: skill C: competition D: tennis court E: legs<n><n>### Response:		Tennis is a sport that requires a combination of physical activity and mental agility.<n>The first requisite for success is the proper technique and execution of strokes. This includes the ability to hit the ball with precision, control, and power. Practice and repetition are essential to achieving proficiency in the fundamental strokes such as forehand, backhand, and serve.<n><n>The player must also be aware of the strategy and tactics involved in the game, including the placement and return of strokes, the use of the court, and the placement of the opponent. This requires mental focus, anticipation, and decision-making.<n><n>Another vital aspect of playing tennis is fitness. Strength, endurance, coordination, and flexibility are all necessary to stay in the game for long periods of time. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle and regular physical activity can help to improve tennis performance.<n><n>The final component is competition. To thrive in the sport, players need a strong competitive spirit and resilience. It is important to stay focused and maintain motivation during difficult matches.<n><n>In summary, to be good at playing Tennis requires dedication, practice, and perseverance. It is a combination of physical prowess and mental acuity that requires effort, discipline, and a positive attitude.<n>Ans: The required components to be good at playing are practice, dedication, and ability to be competitive.<n><n>### Input 2:While John is good at math, he also enjoys helping other students at various different levels. B: No, I only do things that I am good at, like helping others. C: No, I only want to help those who are also good at things! D: Nope!<n><n>

He was frightened.  He didn't want this.  He was scared of what? Choices:  A: death B: coma C: peace D: forgetfulness E: loss of life<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Rationales:<n><n>The sentence  indicates that James was in a precarious situation.  He was losing consciousness, and he was afraid of what that meant.<n><n>Consider options A, B, and C.  Death, coma, and peace are all outcomes at the end of life.  There is nothing that would cause James to be afraid of them.<n><n>Option D is forgetfulness.  However, that is not fear or loss of life.  He did not feel he was losing his memories or becoming less aware.<n><n>That is why the answer is option E: loss of life.<n><n>Answer: E: loss of life

Choices:  A: wasteland B: ocean C: desert D: parking lot E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## #3<n>### Demon:<n>This time we have given you a set of directions. We have also given instructions for how to use those directions. Write an answer sentence for the task.<n><n>### Directions:<n>We have given you the following rules:<n><n>**First,** look at the four pets, and consider this sentence: "Only one of them is a cat."<n>**Second,** then look at our sentence: "That statement has some truth in it."<n><n>1. The two rules are connected, but in a way where they can apply to a much wider class of problems than what our example involves.<n>2. Thus, if you see a sentence like the one described below, you can use the second rule to answer the first problem.<n>3. If you apply the second rule to this example again, then it will also work for the second example.<n>4. If you apply the first rule to "only one of them is a kitten", then it will work.<n>5. Similarly, the statement for the second example can be used to solve the first example.<n>6. This statement is true for "only one of them" and "that pet", so the first rule can be applied to the second rule.<n>7. This gives you the answer "only two of them are pets"<n><n>### Example:<n>The first rule connects the first two sentences as follows:<n><n>We can apply the second rule to the previous example as follows:<n><n>The statement is true, and the second rule was also applicable to the first example.<n><n>Therefore, the answer is "only two of them"<n><n>Answer: It is true that only two of them are pests.<n><n>#### Explanation<n><n>### Rule<n>This time we have shown one of our rules in action. We have also provided you a set of instructions.<n><n>### Explanation and Instructions:<n>The two rules we have given you are:<n><n>1. Apply the first rule to this sentence:<n><n>"That statement has some truth to it"<n>2. Apply the second rule to this sentence: "One of them is a cat"<n><n>### Questions<n><n>Use the following set of questions to think about your answer and your reasoning.<n><n>1. How can you
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:The skin was cut while chopping onions, where was this skin likely cut? Choices:  A: good health B: finger C: meat D: body E: own family<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: D: body<n><n>### Explain your answer using the rationales for all the options<n><n>### Instructions:You will hear ten sentences on CD or MP3. The first statement says that the definition for 'write' is "to express your ideas on paper." However, this indicates expressing ideas (writing) and not necessarily writing (being able to write).<n><n>2. The second statement says that the definition is to "write legibly." This indicates the ability to write, as legibility signifies the ability to interpret handwriting. This is not the definition for to write.<n><n>3. The sentence mentions writing for a long time. However, this is not the same as if someone could write.<n><n>4. The sentence mentions that it is important to write quickly, but this is not the same thing as being able to write.<n><n>Lastly, the answer that fits this situation is 1. A: to express your ideas on paper, as this means that someone could literally write at any time.<n><n>Answer: 1. A. To express your ideas on the paper

Choices:  A: kitchen cupboard B: pantry C: grocery store D: pantry E: refrigerator<n><n>### Response:		If I had _____, I would put it in _____.<n>Rationales:1.We observe the phrase "If I had a". This suggests the answer is not necessary at hand but possible rather than certain.<n>2. We notice that the original condition "If I had a" is followed by the word "spoil".<n>3. Since we know that a jar may spoil if it is left open outside, it follows that we should keep a jar in a place that is secure to prevent spoilage.<n>4. Hence, the correct answer from the choices given is A: kitchen cupboard.<n>5. The statement can also be rewritten as "If I had a ______, I would put it in the _______ ". The sentence then becomes "If I had a jar that may spoil if left unattended, I would put it _____" which shows that the jar being kept in a secure place is the most appropriate response.<n>6. Hence, if I had a _____, I would __________.<n>Answer: A: kitchen cupboard<n><n>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<n>### Instruction I:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>### Demontration:<n>Input: If you want to get some fresh air, where would you go? Choices: A: inside your house B: outside C: in a park D: next to a grocery store E: to another house.<n>Rationales : The question is asking the reader to identify the best destination for "getting some fresh air", so we must consider how each answer choice might be associated with "fresh air" and eliminate any that are obviously incorrect.<n><n><n>In "A", "inside your House", "House" can refer to a single residence such as a house or to a group of buildings that make up a home such as an apartment complex. "House" is not a term that is generally associated with the provision of fresh air for its occupants which makes this choice is clearly incorrect.<n><n>In "B", "outside", refers to the general environment and is a place that is commonly associated with fresh air so this choice is correct.<n><n>In "C", "in a park", is often used to refer to a place where people gather for recreation such as sports or play such as soccer,baseball,picnic,etc. and it is also a location where fresh air

Second, we can see from the context that the man doesn't really try to portray himself as beautiful or any adjective of the kind, since the focus is on how he prepares himself.<n><n>4. A day when my mom and I always spend the day making breakfasts for everyone in our family, while the boys watch The Avengers. Is this the truth?<n><n>### Answer<n>1. On my birthday it's only my mother and me celebrating it without the rest of my siblings. At the end of the day, when they come home from school with their friends, I'm bored and lonely. It's nice to have something to do in the morning before everyone wakes up and gets going - doing breakfast is a nice tradition

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:If you want to make a big splash in a river with a rock, from where should you throw it? Choices:  A: mountains countryside B: ground C: bridge D: mountain range E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: D: mountain range<n><n>### Justification:<n>Looking at each possibility in turn for A: “mountains countryside”, the phrase “countryside” does not specify what kind of countryside being referred to. A rock thrown inland cannot make a splash in the countryside as the surface of water is absent.<n>Similarly, for B: “ground”, the ground is not necessarily a field with a flat surface.<n>For C: “bridge”, the water surface is likely too low to enable the thrown rock to make a splash.<n>For case D: “mountain range”, as there are no other alternatives, the answer must be correct.

Choices:  A: nailed B: carved C: polished D: eat cake E: petrify<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Rationales: If you look at each option carefully, you will see that they make sense in the general sense, and I am sure there are people who have used them in many ways. However, the only option is not correct in this context.<n><n>### Explanation: We see the statement "Nailed to the wall" which involves nailing something to the wall, but it is already known that the wood is fixed somewhere. <n><n>Next, we see "The carved" which can also be used, but it's not quite right. "Carve" doesn't necessarily mean fixating to some object (it can also mean cutting the wood). <n><n>As you look at the choice "Eat cake" It is certainly "fixed for" in some way, but it does not make any sense to think of it as "fixing". <n><n>The other things are correct, but still do not match with the required word, which is "fixing".  After all, if you want to fix wooden furniture, I'm sorry, you can't use the word "eat cake". And so on.<n><n>For "polished" you can see it's a little better. You can do "polish" many wooden items, such as tables or chairs. However, the word "polish" doesn't really say that these objects are permanently fixed or fixed to something else. So although it's better than "eat cake", it's still not the appropriate word.<n><n>And then we have "paved" and "petrify".<n>You can think of wood as "petrified", but this doesn't make any sense when you consider that the word "petrify" means that "the wood is becoming part of the stone", while the word "petrified" means that the wood has become "part of the stone". <n><n>Therefore, it is clear that none of the options is the correct response. <n><n>So you may say that the only choice is "C: Polished". It is closer to the sentence, but it is still not correct. <n><n>I will remind you that the original statement was "Attached something to wood".  In other words, "The wood is something". By contrast, the statement "Polish of the wood" is a little vague. <n><n>

Choices:  A: carpenter's shop B: video game C: garage D: total number E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n>Rationales: As we examine the options, each seems to suggest a different scenario. <n><n>A: If there is only one level in a carpenter's workshop, it would not have more than one level. However, if there were multiple floors in a garage, we could imagine that having more than one level.<n><n>B: Video games typically only have one level, though there can be multiple floors of buildings. <n><n>C: The same as A, but possibly referring to a place to park a car. <n><n>D: It is impossible to tell what the population of a city is based on this statement. <n><n>E: Houses or buildings typically do not refer to a level, but rather to a structure. Therefore, there may be multiple levels in a city, depending on the population.<n><n>Since this is an inference task, we see that it is "likely" for a city to have more than one floors. In fact, there could be more than one floor in a building, a level in a total number, or one level in the "total number" of people in a city.<n><n>Hence the answer must be "more than one level", which is an inference from all the options. For instance, A: "carpenter's shop", B: "video game", C: "garage", D: "total number", and E: "building" do not provide actual answers, but rather scenarios from which we can deduce the answer. <n><n>Therefore, we must assume that there are different types of buildings with different levels or floors within the city population.<n>Answer: More than one level<n><n>### Input <n>This is an inference task that requires the understanding of the context of an excerpt and the use of logical reasoning to answer a question. <n>```<n>In order to succeed at this exercise, it is important to read the excerpt carefully and identify any relevant details that may help you answer the question. Additionally, it is helpful to try to visualize the setting and imagine what type of answer the question is asking for. The answer may be a specific concept or a description of an object or event, depending on the context. <n><n>```<n>We're going to use a system to categorize these types of exercises and help you get better and answer exercises without needing to use a rulebook.<n><n>###

This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:John and Jane were a couple.  They were dating for a while and wanted to be together for even longer. For this reason, they did what? Choices:  A: make sex B: plan to marry C: dance D: electrical circuit E: row about<n><n>### Response:		A: make sex<n><n>### Demostration:<n>First, we start with the sentence "John and Jane were a what?" which is clear about the two individuals involved in the scenario.<n><n>Next, the phrase "during a while" shows that they've been together for a period of time; they're not new.<n><n>They "did what?" is followed by the term "for this reason", which clarifies that there is a specific goal in their relationship.  This is followed by the verb phrase "they wanted to be together for". This indicates a strong commitment to their relationship and clearly states that they're not looking for anything casual. <n><n>Their actions "to be together for even longer" are not further described, so the best option is to take a wild guess and choose B: plan to marry.<n><n>The answer is C: dance. <n><n>### Input John is always giving me advice, but I'm not really sure I want more of what? He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death. Choices: A: the noun B: use C: verb D: adverb E: interjection<n><n>### Answer' A: the noun<n><n>### Ration:The phrase 'when to use' means 'when to use what'. Using the phrase literally then, 'what' could take the place of when. This phrase has a lot of structure, and thus, a lot of grammar. As a result, the answer must be either an interjection (shout), adverb (when), or a verb (to use). The first two are not relevant, because they are not parts of speech that you would use in combination with a noun. The last option is the only one.<n><n>### Answer:'We like to use who when...' Choices A: the noun; B: use; C: verb; D: adverb; E: interjection<n>Rationale: The phrase

It couldn’t be bad, they could do a show after ours and we could promote theirs as part of ours!" "We have to have a..." can be replaced with what? Choices: A: special guest artist B: the gallery owner C: the main exhibit D: the main artist E: all the artists<n><n>### Response:"We have to have" is in the conditional mood, so you can say "We have to HAVE" or "We HAVE to have." This shows that you know that this is conditional mood.<n><n>This conditionally requires that we "could call somebody from this year's art school!" This indicates that something should happen in the future. The person cannot be called as of now.<n><n>Finally, "We could promote theirs as  part of ours!" indicates that "ours" is an object. Thus, the correct response is "D: the main artist."<n><n>Answer: D: "We have to have the main artist."<n>#### How did you come up with this answer?<n><n>I looked at all possible replacements of the conditional statement<n><n>* We have to have the gallery owner<n>This doesn’t make sense. There is no need for us to need to have the gallery owner because we are already holding the gallery.<n><n>* We have TO have the main exhibit<n>It seems to mean that we need to change from having an exhibit, which is plural.<n><n>* We HAVE TO have the main artist<n>I chose this one because I don’t think the conditionals “We have to have” means anything other than “this may or may not happen at a future point.”<n><n>* We HAD to have all the artists<n>I don’t think we have to go

However, the choices given are not valid options for this activity.<n><n>Alternatively, B states that the chef is studying french cooking, which does not make sense given the context. A chef should already know how to cook French meals;  learning a different style would not be beneficial at that point of employment.<n><n>The only valid answer that makes sense in light of both statements is C - the chef prepares food and taste sauce in order to ensure that the food is up to standards.<n><n>In conclusion, B and C make the most sense as responses, while A, D, and E do not align with the context.<n><n>### Input : What does an airline chef do to improve customer service? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:After his mother saw his report card he knew he was going to be doing housework, what could have prevented this? Choices:  A: sneezing B: fatigue C: house clean D: feeling satisfied E: getting good grades<n><n>### Response:		The statement "his mother saw his report card" suggests that the mother had been waiting for him to bring home his report card.<n><n><n>The options for the answer all begin with "what could have...", indicating that the correct answer must be something the son could not have done.<n><n>Looking to the statements mentioned in the options, A: sneezed (could not be prevented), B: gotten tired (could not be prevent), C: cleaned the house (could not be prevent, but if the son failed his report card, he may have tried hard to earn higher grades), D: felt satisfied (could not prevent), and E: gotten good grades (could not have prevented but may had some influence).<n><n>Thus, the correct answer is that the son did housework because he felt "incompetent" (C) or "guilty" (D). <n><n>The statements "he was going to be doing 'house' work" and "the consequence of which was doing 'house' work," emphasize the role of housework as a result or an indirect consequence of "incompetent or guilty feeling." <n><n>Answer: C: did the housework because he felt incompetent or guilty.  If the child had done something different, such as cleaning the house the night before the report card was given, it would likely not have been the cause of his father's feelings of "guilt/incompetency" which prompted him to ask the child to do the housework.<n><n>### Input:(Write your responses in the space below) How could you help your child or student to understand a text with difficult words and phrases? Choices:  A: notoriety B: emotional distress C: riot D: bad dreams E: annoyance<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Deductive approach:<n>Here is an example of a strategy that attempts to prove a point by logically deduction, rather than relying solely on an inference. Though the following approach works for some questions, it is best to use it in conjunction with other, more in-depth approaches. <n><n>### Inference:<n>As long as your answer choice options are not too vague, this should give you most of what you need. It is better than asking for the author’s opinion directly.<n><n>### Conclusion: Telling many people about an embarassing situation leads to notoriety, but also emotional distress, as they react differently to different things. However, bad dreams and annoyance will not follow after telling people unless the situation is particularly severe.<n><n>### Thinking about your choices:<n>The following list of choices is presented. You should choose the answer that is the most logical choice, rather than choosing to fit a certain way of answering questions on multiple choice tests.<n><n>- The correct answer is (C): riot<n>- The correct answer (D): bad dreams<n>- The correct answer choice is (A): notoriety<n>- The correct answer, while not directly covered on the given multiple choice test, is (B): emotional distress<n>- You should not worry about the choice (B) to use emotional distress, since (A) and (C) were good answers as well.<n><n>### Inferences:<n>The word "telling" implies that the situation does not need to be embarassing or humiliating. For instance, telling people that you ate a salad and felt hungry shortly after (especially with some context or explanation given) is not going to lead to any rioting as long as the situation is not otherwise extreme.<n><n>Another example would be that while telling people about a bad break up might cause you emotional distress, and might lead them to feel sadder for you, there would not be riots happening as a result of that single revelation.<n><n>### Reactions:<n>Emotional distress is often a result of receiving a reaction from an audience to an embarrassing situation. Whether the response is positive, negative, or neutral will be an important factor to how you respond or handle the embarrassment. In other words, what is important is the reaction of others, not

Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? Choices:  A: bookstore B: house C: race track D: friend's house E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n>An appropriate response to this question would be Option B. In the context of this passage, Option A refers to books, Option C refers to horse races, Option D refers to a friend's house and Option E does not make sense. Thus, the only valid option is Option B, which refers to a house. This is supported by the fact that Option B refers to a "house" when the answer was asked where to sit for an event involving four-legged animals. These pieces of evidence prove that Option B is the correct response.<n><n>### Question:Which word describes the person who is always trying for things that aren't necessary? Choices:  a: a lazy person B: a clown C: an idealist D: a nihilist E: a minimalist<n>Rationales<n><n>Given the question text, a "nihilist" describes someone who tries for things that are not necessary. This is because these things do not add any value to their lives, and thus are not worth trying to accomplish. On the other hand, "a nihilist" does not describe the person who is always striving for things that are nonessential, such as a "lazy person" or "an idealist." The correct response is thus D: nihilist.<n><n>### Input:(1) There were three people in the office during the work week. (2) Only two of them were at work on weekends. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What would children do if they are bored? Choices:  A: walk B: change shoes C: play tag D: smell smoke E: reach over<n><n>### Response:		Play Tag<n><n>### Rationales:<n>First, the question asks what children would do if they were bored. This implies that the answer involves an action that children might do in that situation, rather than something they might not do, like sleep or take a nap. <n><n>Next, looking at the choices we can see that they each represent actions that children might possibly do in the situation described above. <n><n>From there, we look only to answer choices which involve an opportunity for physical activity. The two options that fit this criteria are A and D. They each involve actions which encourage playful interaction and movement.<n><n>However, while A: "walk" can be a form of physical activity, the act of walking does not involve any degree of competition or interaction, such as that which describes tag, or it doesn't encourage movement. Both describe the child as the passive participant, and thus are not the best answer.<n><n>Consideration of D: "play tag" fits the description, as it involves physical activity and interaction. This action has children as participants who chase each other while attempting to avoid capture. This shows a level of excitement and competition, allowing for children to engage their physicality while interacting through play. <n><n>Hence, according to the given criteria, D: "play Tag" is the best answer.<n>

Choices:  A: apartment B: classroom C: buildings D: car E: audience<n><n>### Response:		<n>A) Apartment:<n>Apartments typically consist of a small group of individuals living together, therefore it is impossible for any apartment to contain more than 100 people at a time.<n><n>B) Classroom, in the sense of a school class:<n>Classroom is more specifically associated with a class and not just a group of individuals; therefore, a class can contain more than 1,000 people if they are all students seated in their respective desks in a lecture hall.<n><n>C) Buildings<n>Even if all the buildings in a city contain 100 people each, it would be impossible for them to amount to a total of 1,001 buildings.<n><n>D) Car, in the sense of an automobile:<n>This option has multiple possible definitions, but for the purposes of this discussion, it will be assumed to mean the interior of an automobile. Even though cars can be designed to accommodate 1 or more individuals, there are only so many spaces available in a car at any given time, making it impossible to contain more than 99 people inside any given car.<n><n>E) Audience at a stand up comedy show:<n>Even in an ideal environment, it would be impossible to squeeze more than 101 people onto the seats of a typical theater. But for the purpose of this discussion, let us assume that all seats of the theater are filled, plus some additional individuals standing in the back and/or in the aisleways in order to fill every nook and cranny available. Even in this best-case scenario, we still can't account for more than 105-106 people in an audience.<n><n>Having explored each of these 5 options, it becomes clear that the only correct answer is option (D) (car, in the sense of the interior of an automobiles). Every single other option, no matter how creative they seem to be, either falls flat under scrutiny or just does not make any sense in the context of the original question. Answer: D) a car<n><n>### Suggested Instruction:<n>What would likely contain more than 150 people?  <n>Answer: Classroom<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Answer as many questions correctly as you can. Choices:  A: compliments B: understand themselves C: life partner D: second chances E: larger house<n><n>### Response:		<n>You've been given the instruction to write a response which "appropriately completes the request".  Since you have been given one instruction, you must reply by writing the correct response and only the correct response(s), as opposed to a new instruction that includes that answer choice as well.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>In this task, the correct completion would have been:  E: larger house, "When they have more kids, people need a larger house."<n>If you did not include the answer choice, the response to writing one more kid should include a statement indicating that a person needs a larger house.  For example, instead of the original statement, "Where does a person get when they have more dogs?" The response would be, "In order to get a dog, a person usually needs a home," or "One must go to an animal shelter to get a dog." The response should only include the part after the parenthetical. This was not given in the task and should not be included. <n><n>The only valid answer choices in the task would be : A: compliments B, understand themselves C: life companion D: second chances and E: larger house.<n><n>Answer: E: larger house
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:Riding bike through rough terrain can be dangerous, one could find themselves what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: accident C: get somewhere D: hurt E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		What would a bike crash on rough terrain be? Choices:  C: accident E:  pleasure F: getting somewhere<n><n>### Explain why the choice you chose is correct for each part of the question. Answer<n><n>### This question is asking you to choose what you think a bike crash on a rough terrain would be.<n>### What we want is the word "accident."<n>### So if we look at the options, we can see that "accident" is the opposite (antonym) of "pleasure." Since that is what we want, it means that pleasure is not the correct answer, making it unacceptable.<n>### So what are the other options?<n>### We see the word "accident" in "risk," which says "the possibility of incurring harm, loss, or other adversarial or unfavorable conditions."<n>### Thus, risk is dangerous, and that is what we want.<n>### Lastly, looking at "pleasure," it just simply refers to "enjoyment," which is not what we want.<n><n>### Risk can be negative, which is what we want in this particular scenario, so it is the correct option.<n><n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: bowl of soup B: serving dish C: table setting D: placemat E: glass of iced tea<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is B: serving dish.  The correct answer is not A: bowl of spoon because it would be placed in the bowl (of the soup), and not on one side of the bowl. If it's on one side of the plate, that side should contain the serving dish.  <n><n>---<n><n>- [ ] This is the 17e [Learning Pattern](../../../learning-pattern/Learning_Pattern/index.md), (Learning through multiple choice-type questions) - (21p.)<n><n>- [ ] Task Name: Fill in the Blank<n><n>---<n><n>### 아래는 과제의 개요를 드는 요단입니다.<n><n>- [ ] 과제 사실에 대해 자세히 설명합니다.<n><n>### 실행:표의 기능에 위해 수행해야 할 알맞은 대답을 기록합니다.<n>### 지시문:<n>어떤 사항에 대한 모든 선택적 질문 요단을 하나 작성합니다.<n>- [ ] 모든 C<n><n>### 게시판:<n>설명:<n><n>### 해결방법의 응답<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What does a virus primarily do to a person? Choices:  A: infect B: reproduce C: mutate D: eat food E: make computer malfunction<n><n>### Response:		D: it mutates, infects and sometimes reproduces<n><n>### Demonsration:<n>Given the sentence, one thing that a virus does to a person is mutate.  But a virus can also infect and reproduce. This means that the answer must be somewhere between C and D, or B and E.<n><n>Next, let us think of what makes sense in the sentence, in particular the words "mostly" and "primarily".<n><n>Thus, virus primarily does to a person is to mutate. <n><n>In addition, a virus can infect and sometimes reproduce. <n><n>Hence, a virus's primary role is to mutate, but a virus can also infict and reproduce.<n><n>Answer: A: it mutates, B: it infects, C: it reproduces, D: it eat fod, E: it makes computer malfunction<n><n><n>### Instructions:Complete each statement.<n>### Demonsrtation(1):<n><n>Given the sentence "he was an efficient person" we can see that the implication is for the person to be effective at getting things done.<n><n>Thus, as there are two different ways of getting things done, the complete of the statement is likely to be with adjectives that pertain to being effective at what the person does. <n><n>In other words, the response will need to be something that implies the person is skilled at being effective in some way.<n><n>Let's see if the answers satisfy the context.<n><n>1. He was a ______ person, he was skilled at getting things done in a timely manner.<n>2. She was a _______ person, she could complete a task despite having lots of competing responsibilities.<n>3. It was a ______ day, the sky was cloudy and the people were gloomy.<n>4. _____ people love to read and write books. <n>5. _______ people get more done than others<n>6. She was a ___________ dog, he would eat his food quickly and without mess.<n>7. The _______ people were the ones that would always complain about the weather.<n>8. Someone will eventually notice how __________ you are.<n><n>The only answers that satisfy all of the above are 5 and 1.<n><n>This means that the complete

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What is a place that might not always have a queen? Choices:  A: bee hive B: england C: castle D: deck of cards E: chess game<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer based on this example is choice (E). Bee hives may occasionally be Queenless, though they tend to have Queens.<n><n>### Rationale: "What is a place that _may not always have_ a queen?" The correct answer choice is indicated by the question mark in the statement: "Queen" is the object of the direct question, and implies that "place" is singular, so choice (E) is the only answer that aligns with the context here, since "place" is always referring to a single location (and a place can't be a Queen, the Queen is the woman). The question doesn't ask about "places that sometimes don't _have_ queens". It doesn't ask about places that _have_ queens sometimes. It is specifically in the context of cases when a single space-item can't "always have a queen" (thus, a single place can't always have a queen). <n><n>### Answer: E: "chess game"<n><n>### Input<n>>What is a sentence that is both complete and incomplete?<n><n>### Response<n>Choices:<n><n>1. "A sentence is a (complete, incomplete)"<n>2. "Incomplete sentence is (abbreviate, full)"<n><n>Answer: 2. <n><n>Explaination:<n><n>Since the question asks for a sentence that combines complete and incomplete, the best choices to fill in the blank should reflect that. <n><n>Choice 1 seems to be missing a word, so I think it should be replaced with an other verb and a subject. <n><n>Choice2 is my answer because it fulfils the task and shows both a complete and incomplete sentence. Plus the other choice is incomplete, so it's not perfect, it's the same as a full sentence, not a combination between complete and incomplete.<n><n>Answer: "The sentence could be incomplete or complete. If incomplete, it is a lack of information, meaning no information. If complete is all information, meaning information filled.

I would like to know what you think I should do rather than a bunch of answers like "I think both would be good." <n><n>### Instructions: <n>Write a response in which you advise the writer what to do. This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:People are purposefully harming others, what trait are they exhibiting? Choices:  A: deceptive B: altruistic C: stupid D: cruel E: agressive<n><n>### Response:		The person's intention to harm others is being described, thus it is obvious they exhibit a negative trait. Choosing between the options should be done based on the level of harm and the motivation.<n><n>Although choices B and C have the appearance of a negative trait, they may be the result of lack of information or simply carelessness. Deception is a purposeful choice, and cruelty is a very harmful action.  Thus, cruelty should be the answer.<n><n>Answer: E: cruelty<n><n>### Input:"Do what makes you happy." This is a popular phrase often used by self-help authors. However, happiness is subjective. In the end, nobody can make you what? Choices: A: happy B: sad C: angry D: motivated <n><n>### Response:"Happiness is subjective. Therefore, nobody can make you happy." is a logical conclusion to the scenario.<n><n>Happy is an expression of contentment, which differs from person to person and is not based on external factors.  This means that nobody can control someone else's happiness and make them happy. If you want to be happy, you must take steps to achieve it yourself.<n><n>Answer: D: motivated<n><n>### Input"In his last year of studies, Bill studied medicine. He was already qualified to practice as a what? Choices: a doctor b counselor c pharmacist d physical therapist<n><n>### Response"In his last year" states that he had already attained the goal which is to become a doctor. There are 3 options but one is more likely to be the correct answer than the others.<n><n>### We look at the options to see which of them Bill has become already. To be a doctor, he would need to be qualified to practice as a doctor.<n><n>Doctor is the topmost ranking medical profession who are qualified to practice and so it is the correct answer. The other 2, Counselor and physical therapist are professionals with different degrees.<n><n>Answer: A: Doctor<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:The person is laying on the beach, why would he do that? There are many ways that they might think and I am going to talk about 5 options which are good for someone that is trying to think about something. The first example is to make a list and make sure that everything is in order and then the next example is to talk a look at the list and think of something and then write a plan for the project. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The sentence states that John gave a "perfunctory" examination. The word "perfunctory" means doing something with minimum effort or reflection. <n>2. Thus, although John did everything required, there is an implication that the examination was done too quickly or without enough attention to detail.<n>3. The statement also mentions that he missed the cause of death, which implies a lack of completeness in his examination.<n>4. From the choices given, the word that fits this scenario is "thorough." <n>5. Being more "thorough" implies being more detailed, comprehensive, and leaving no part overlooked, which aligns with the context.<n>6. Therefore, if John had been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.  Therefore, the answer is D: thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Rationales: First, we observe the statement "Everybody has some sort of creativity." This suggests that the answer will be something that is applicable to everyone, not just artists, writers, or seamstresses.<n><n>Next, we consider the phrase "it's the best way to". This implies that the completion of the sentence should indicate the most effective or beneficial use of creativity.<n><n>Looking at the options, A: "create art", B: "write", and C: "sew" are activities which indeed require creativity, but they are specific skills that not everyone has.<n><n>Considering D: "create idea", while creativity certainly helps in generating ideas, the phrasing seems awkward. <n><n>Last, we look at E: "express yourself." This includes all forms of creative expression, not limited to any specific skills or talents. This makes it a universal application of creativity, which aligns with the opening clause of the statement.<n><n>Hence, the answer is E: "express yourself."<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>### Input:What does someone want when having fun with their friends and trying to fit in? Choices:  A: middle east B: palace C: dictionary D: pots E: apartment<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you had chosen A, B, or C, the answer would have been completely incorrect! There is a logical explanation why.<n><n>A: If you chose the Middle East, this would lead to a false conclusion that a ficus plant wouldn't brighten up an apartment.<n><n>The Middle East is a region in the Asia-Pacific region and has a low number of palm trees.<n><n>B: If you chose a palace, this would lead to the false conclusion that a ficum plant would brighten up only palaces.<n><n>A palace as a place where the rich and powerful live, which is not all rooms in the world.<n><n>C: If you chose the dictionary, this would lead to an incorrect conclusion that the plant wouldn't bright up an apartment. <n><n>The Ficus is a genus of about 850 tropical species of woody trees, shrubs, vines, epiphytes, and hemiepiphytes.<n>Most ficus species are native to Asia, Africa, and Oceania.<n><n>D: If you chose the pots or apartment, this would be incorrect because it can brighten up both of them.<n><n>E: If you chose "an apartment," this would be completely correct because a Ficus would easily brighten up an apath.<n><n>Answer: E: an apartment because it can easily brighten the apartment.<n><n>### Input:"It doesn't matter how a person begins, what matters is what they do."  Choices:  A. begin something B. do something C. be a part D. change something E. start something<n><n>### Response:"It doesn't really matter how a person begins because what really matters is what they do afterward."<n><n>A: "Begin something" refers to the start of an activity rather than the end.<n><n>B: "Do something" implies that the person will be actively involved in an activity.<n><n>C: "Be a part" refers to the involvement of the individual in the activity. <n><n>D: "Change something" implies that the individual will change or influence an aspect of the activity.<n><n>E: "Start something" involves an initiative or a start of an activity. <n><n>Hence, A is the answer.<n><n>Answer: A: begin something because it refers to the start of the activity rather
